org.activebpel.rt.bpeladmin.war.web.graph
Class AeGraphImageDriver

java.lang.Object
  org.activebpel.rt.bpeladmin.war.web.graph.AeGraphImageDriver
public class AeGraphImageDriver
extends java.lang.Object

Draws the BPEL graph on an off-screen graphics context and sends the rendered image to an instance of IAeGraphImageResponse.

Nested Class Summary
private static class AeGraphImageDriver.AeResourceAllocationException
          Exception to indicate that the graphics context required more memory than the maximum allocated amount.

private int mImageColorDepth
Buffered image's color depth (8 or 16 bits)

mMaxMemory

private int mMaxMemory
Max memory (in MB) allocated for the graph image. A value of <= 0 means it is unbounded.

The target response object for this driver.

sendImageTile

protected void sendImageTile(AeBpelGraph aBpelGraph,
                             int aRow,
                             int aCol,
                             int aTileWidth,
                             int aTileHeight)
                      throws AeException,
                             java.io.IOException
Renders a subsection of an image and sends it out as jpeg stream.

Parameters:
aBpelGraph - BPEL process graph container
aRow - tile row offset, starting with 1.
aCol - tile coloumn offset, starting with 1.
aTileWidth - image title width.
aTileHeight - image title height.
Throws:
AeException
java.io.IOException

encode

protected void encode(java.awt.image.BufferedImage aImage,
                      java.awt.Graphics aGraphics)
               throws java.io.IOException,
                      AeException
Encodes the given image and sends the encoding to the response stream.

The .NET implementation overrides this method to encode the .NET Bitmap that backs the Graphics object in the IKVM runtime with a .NET JPEG encoder.

Parameters:
aImage -
aGraphics -
Throws:
java.io.IOException
AeException

sendErrorImageStream

public void sendErrorImageStream()
Streams out the data for a stock (place holder) image if any errors are caught during the graphing process.
